Description: A pottery flask in the form of a couchant horse, front legs tucked back, rear legs brought forward. The rectangular saddle is decorated with a relief pattern, held solely by a girth, with a ring for tightening shown on the horse's left side. Rising vertically from the hindquarters is a cylindrical spout with a flaring mouth adorned with two plain mouldings. It has a plain oval base, flat below. Two-piece mould. Dark-brown Nile silt; overall dark-brown to black slip: Memphis Black Ware.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Acquired in the Fayum. Ptolemaic, second to first century BC. Bibliog: Johns 2006: 162.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3746)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
